intro: Solms-laubachia linearifolia, commonly known as the slender-leaf solms-laubachia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries such as Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and showy, pale yellow to cream-colored flowers. It typically grows in open woodland or grassland habitats. Solms-laubachia linearifolia is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to cultivate in warm climates.
